messages.title: Building an NHS with time to care
messages.content: 20,000 more nurses, 8,000 more GPs, A GP appointment within 48 hours, Cancer tests and results within a week

messages.title: Labour's tough new approach to immigration
messages.content: It's fair that before drawing on the welfare state, people should first make a contribution to it. That's why Labour will stop people claiming benefits until they have lived here for at least two years. Those who have lost control of our borders have no idea who is coming in or out of the country. That's why Labour will bring in 1,000 extra border staff to cut people in and out of the country as we fingerprint checks to clamp down on illegal immigration. People who rely on public services have a right to expect that staff, like nurses and care workers, can speak English. That is why Labour will make sure that all frontline public sector staff can speak English.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour proposes to hire 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs, ensure GP appointments within 48 hours, and provide cancer tests and results within a week.

Labour's immigration policy includes stopping people from claiming benefits until they have lived in the UK for at least two years, hiring 1,000 extra border staff, and ensuring all frontline public sector workers can speak English.

issues.governance: Labour criticizes the current government for losing control of the borders and proposes to bring in 1,000 extra border staff to ensure proper checks.
issues.health: Labour is committed to improving the NHS by hiring more nurses and GPs, reducing wait times for appointments and tests, and opposing the privatization of the NHS.
issues.immigration: Labour commits to requiring immigrants to live in the UK for two years before claiming welfare, hiring additional border staff, and requiring language proficiency for public sector workers.

quotes.text: You can't trust the Tories with the NHS. A&E is in crisis - NHS waiting lists are at their highest levels for six years and it's getting harder to see a GP. £3bn wasted on reorganisation they promised wouldn't happen.
The Lib Dems have backed the Tories all the way. Backed the Tories' NHS privatisation agenda. Backed Cameron's damaging NHS reorganisation. Put private profit before patient care.
UKIP want to scrap our free NHS. Nigel Farage wants a US-style healthcare system. This would mean huge bills for patients. UKIP would charge you to see your GP.

images.caption: Labour flyer depicting health professionals in a hospital setting and emphasizing their commitment to the NHS.

leaflet.additionalNotes: This leaflet mentions Nigel Farage's quote from 12th October 2012 about moving to an insurance-based system of healthcare. It associates UKIP with the threat of an American-style healthcare system, with listed costs for various treatments, such as cancer treatment and knee replacement.
